image.altText: A man with glasses wearing a navy suit stands behind a podium speaking seriously.

props.synopsis: ACT Chief Minister Andrew Barr acknowledges that leadership of the Labor party will "need to transition to a new generation" but argues stability is vital as Labor governs without the Greens.

title.children: 'Not thinking of retirement': Barr concedes succession looms but says experience key

image.altText: The exterior of a concrete building with the words "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory" over the entry.

props.synopsis: A 17-year-old Canberra boy is behind bars after shocking allegations he developed detailed plans for public attacks and had equipment to create a bomb in his bedroom.

title.children: Canberra 'wannabe terrorist' behind bars over plans to attack protesters

image.altText: Sena, an older woman wearing a headscarf and purple vest, stands looking serious, leaning against a wall.

props.synopsis: Sena Husic left a war-zone in Bosnia 30 years ago for Australia, and went on to suffer debilitating spinal pain because of the language barrier she struggled to overcome. Now she's finally received treatment, but there a calls for translators to bridge the gap.

title.children: Sena needed surgery, but she couldn't understand her doctors

image.altText: A man and a woman walking along the street.

props.synopsis: Three men at the centre of one of NSW's biggest corruption cases are fighting to overturn their jail terms over a $30 million coal deal tied to a family property.

title.children: Obeids and Macdonald take $30m coal corruption case to High Court

image.altText: A woman with long blonde hair wearing a black blazer stands in a conference room looking serious.

props.synopsis: The Australian National University's dire financial situation is "improving", and interim vice-chancellor Rebekah Brown says the university has now set a new target of delivering a surplus next year.

title.children: Rebekah Brown says ANU campus 'a lot calmer' since she came on board

image.altText: David Pocock

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's 2023 promise to fix a "building with buckets to collect leaks" remains unfulfilled, according to the National Gallery of Australia's annual report.

title.children: Pocock slams government over leaky roof housing $5b national collection

image.altText: A woman wearing a serious facial expression as she is interviewed by a journalist.

props.synopsis: Leanne Liddle knows what it takes to cut it as a police officer, but says tackling racism within the ranks has been her toughest assignment yet.

title.children: NT Police anti-racism strategy architect speaks out about 'hardest job' of her life

image.altText: A man with brown hair speaks into a microphone and adjusts his red Make American Great Again cap

props.synopsis: A school investigation has been launched after an Adelaide teacher allegedly dressed up as slain US conservative activist Charlie Kirk for Halloween, with the school's principal slamming the decision to wear such a costume as "completely unacceptable".

title.children: School sorry for 'unacceptable' Charlie Kirk costume at Halloween event

image.altText: A poster of a young girl holding a teddy bear

props.synopsis: Temu and Shein are under increasing pressure to explain how child sex abuse dolls were sold worldwide on their multi-billion-dollar platforms following international outrage.

title.children: Shein, Temu face more pressure after claims pleas on sex dolls were 'ignored'

image.altText: A dingo rests on a sandy foreshore.

props.synopsis: People could be allowed to keep dingoes as pets in Queensland under proposed changes to biosecurity regulations, but experts say the native animal is fundamentally different to domestic dogs.

title.children: Queensland considers changes that could see dingoes in dog parks

image.altText: firefighters on the tarmac

props.synopsis: Virgin Australia says all 180 passengers aboard flight VA454 were able to disembark as normal.

title.children: Fire sparks on plane moments after landing at Brisbane Airport

image.altText: Gough Whitlam listens to dismissal announcement

props.synopsis: The main characters are dead. But some of those who were around at the time still maintain their rage, decades after the events in question.

title.children: From the best seats in the house, I watched history be made

image.altText: Macquarie Group headquarters, Sydney

props.synopsis: Macquarie shares tumble on a disappointing earnings update, dragging the ASX 200 lower on Friday. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Macquarie Group shares tumble, weighing on the ASX

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Where is Australia's unemployment rate headed and will there be rate cuts in 2026?
ASIC vows to better educate consumers about financial matters
Elon Musk's xAI push to preoccupy the board

image.altText: Profile of a man.

props.synopsis: Vice Admiral Jonathan Mead's retirement will come just a year before the first US nuclear-powered submarine is due to be deployed to Western Australia in 2027 under the AUKUS agreement.

title.children: Australia's 'no fail' submarine mission set for shake-up as boss quits

image.altText: Smoke rising from behind buildings

props.synopsis: The Israeli military carries out air strikes on southern Lebanon after issuing evacuation orders for several locations, saying it targeted weapons storage facilities for Hezbollah.

title.children: UN says Israeli strikes in southern Lebanon violate ceasefire

image.altText: an area crowded with makeshift tents with palm trees in the perimeter

props.synopsis: A small sense of normalcy has returned in some areas of Gaza, but other parts remain under Israeli military control, fuelling concerns the strip is being divided.

title.children: How the 'yellow line' could split Gaza into two very different halves

image.altText: The sun rises above a highway in a red and yellow sky.

props.synopsis: According to the World Meteorological Organization, each of the past 11 years has been the warmest in 176 years of observations — and it will be "virtually impossible" to limit global warming to 1.5C in the next few years.

title.children: 'Unprecedented' temperatures continue, with 2025 among three warmest years on record

image.altText: Posters of a person throwing a sandwich are pictured along a wall with graffiti

props.synopsis: Sean Charles Dunn became a symbol of resistance to Mr Trump's deployment of federal agents in the nation's capital following a viral video showing him tossing a sandwich at a Customs and Border Protection agent.

title.children: Man who threw sandwich at US border agent found not guilty of assault

image.altText: Prince Andrew looks unhappy as he is dressed in a dark suit surrounded by a crowd of people.

props.synopsis: A US congressional panel has summoned the former British prince Andrew Mountbatten Windsor for questioning over his ties to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title.children: Former prince Andrew summoned by US politicians over Epstein ties

image.altText: A man wearing a red leather jacket, with curly locks across his forehead, smiles

props.synopsis: Antoine Fuqua's movie was meant to be released months ago, but was delayed twice because of reshoots and eventually pushed back to April 2026 — a whole year behind schedule.

title.children: Trailer for Michael Jackson biopic released a year behind schedule — with a glaring gap

image.altText: Maree and Mervyn Schwartz smile at the camera.

props.synopsis: A trial date has been set for a Queensland grazier accused of shooting three people dead at a rural Queensland property in 2022.

title.children: Trial date set for Queensland grazier accused of murdering three neighbours

image.altText: Floral and teddy bear tributes at the scene of a fire.

props.synopsis: Investigators are trying to piece together the cause of a blaze in central Queensland that has left a family devastated and residents in shock.

title.children: Community mourns as man and three children die in house fire

image.altText: Two men in black clothes.

props.synopsis: Police believe two men travelled to Melbourne from NSW to carry out the fatal shooting of 21-year-old Athan Boursinos in July.

title.children: NSW organised crime link to fatal Melbourne shooting

image.altText: A close up shot of a police officer's hands fixing handcuffs to a man's hands that are behind his back.

props.synopsis: As Victoria grapples with a crime wave, the ABC takes a deeper look at some of the numbers behind the rise in offences.

title.children: The statistics behind Victoria's crime wave

image.altText: A patient lies on a couch while an AI bot listens to their concerns.

props.synopsis: Artificial intelligence chatbots like ChatGPT are embedded in modern life, with some Australians using them to help work through PTSD and toxic work environments.

title.children: 'Claude never sleeps': The new AI therapists that don't judge, get tired or need an appointment

image.altText: The crest of the Katherine Town Council on a wall, showing the motif of a gorge.

props.synopsis: Dozens of council workers in the Top End town of Katherine could be set to receive thousands of dollars in back pay, after the Fair Work Commission found in their favour.

title.children: 'Wage theft': Katherine Town Council ordered to pay back workers

image.altText: A wide shot of suburban housing on a hill.

props.synopsis: The role of migration is one of the most contentious elements to the housing debate. So what does the evidence show?

title.children: These charts show the effect of migration on Australia's housing story

image.altText: Nick Kyrgios sits and looks in front of him

props.synopsis: Nick Kyrgios insists he won't be taking Aryna Sabalenka lightly but nor is he ready to be rolled by the women's world number-one in their Battle of the Sexes clash.

title.children: Can Kyrgios beat the best female player in the world? He thinks so

image.altText: A man in a maroon football jersey standing under a bright stadium light smiles.

props.synopsis: Daly Cherry-Evans' decorated stint at Manly, spanning 352 games and plenty of highlights, is officially over after his move to a rival NRL club.

title.children: Cherry-Evans confirms historic switch after 352-game Manly career

image.altText: Harmanpreet Kaur celebrates with the World Cup trophy

props.synopsis: In a short period of time, women's cricket in India has travelled from uneven, dusty grounds to floodlit stadiums packed with roaring fans. The team's upset victory promises yet more investment in the women's game from the world's most fanatical cricketing nation.

title.children: With India's World Cup victory, women's cricket is forever changed

image.altText: a man walks next to an uprooted tree trunk the fell on a green gate in the front yard of a house

props.synopsis: Typhoon Kalmaegi lashes Vietnam with fierce winds and torrential rain as it makes landfall, after leaving at least 188 people dead and 135 missing in the Philippines.

title.children: Typhoon Kalmaegi kills 188 in Philippines, makes landfall in Vietnam

image.altText: Marshawn Kneeland looks at the camera

props.synopsis: The NFL is in mourning after the tragic and sudden loss of Dallas Cowboys defensive end Marshawn Kneeland, who was just 24.

title.children: NFL player Marshawn Kneeland of Dallas Cowboys dies aged 24

image.altText: A dragonfly with yellow and brown wings clutching a grass tip.

props.synopsis: What flies like a helicopter and devours mosquitoes? Meet the 2025 ABC Australian Insect of the Year.

title.children: Insect of the year votes are in and bug lovers are all a-flutter

image.altText: Oscar Piastri looks to one side

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri has said he is still a serious contender for the Formula 1 world championship despite seeing his lead evaporate over the past five races.

title.children: Piastri says he 'has still got what it takes' to win F1 crown

image.altText: A man stands on the horizon, completely silhouetted by the moon, in sand dunes in Lancelin. January 31, 2018.

props.synopsis: There has been a lot going on in the headlines this week — were you paying attention?

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A supermoon, a famous bathroom and last horse over the line at the Melbourne Cup
